title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A 
- Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) (Amendment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 2nd day of June
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health act 1947 (section 31a - temporary restrictions) (covid-19) (no 2) (amendment) regulation 2021 (2) regulation shall come operation 2nd day june

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 4. Regulation 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) 

in paragraph (a) of the definition of “necessary person”, by the 
deletion of “referred to in Regulation 10(2)(b)”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following definitions: 

“ ‘relevant venue’ means a fixed or temporary venue, 
including a stadium, arena, grandstand, park, pitch or 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 4th June, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 3 

golf course, that would, but for the restrictions on 
attendance at events provided for by these Regulations, 
be capable of accommodating at least 5,000 persons 
outdoors; 

‘scheduled event’ has the meaning assigned to it by 
Regulation 3A;”.

heading: 7. Regulation 9 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
7. Regulation 9 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 

substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (2): 

“(2) A person may organise, or cause to be organised, a 
wedding in a relevant geographical location in a premises or premises, 
as the case may be, other than a dwelling where the person takes all 
reasonable steps to ensure that – 

(a) 

in the case of a wedding that takes place before 
the 7th day of June 2021 – 

(i) 

(ii) 

the number of persons attending, or 
proposed to attend, the wedding service 
does not exceed 50, and 

the number of persons attending, or 
proposed to attend, the wedding reception 
– 

 
 
 
 [267] 5 

(I) 

(II) 

does not exceed 6, where the 
reception is held indoors, or 

does not exceed 15, where the 
reception is held outdoors, or 

(b) 

in the case of a wedding that takes place on or 
after the 7th day of June 2021 – 

(i) 

(ii) 

the number of persons attending, or 
proposed to attend, the wedding service 
does not exceed 50, and 

the number of persons attending, or 
proposed to attend, the wedding reception 
does not exceed 25.”.

heading: Concert halls.
text_raw:
13. 

Concert halls. 

Theatres insofar as they operate before the 7th day of June 2021. 

Art galleries (other than privately owned art galleries offering 
artworks for sale) except insofar as they operate to provide 
general admittance to members of the public. 

Museums, except insofar as they operate to provide general 
admittance to members of the public. 

Libraries, except insofar as they operate to provide lending 
services to members of the public. 

Cultural indoor attractions, except insofar as they operate to 
provide general admittance to members of the public. 

Circuses. 

Nightclubs and discotheques, including those licenced under the 
Public Dance Halls Act 1935 (No. 2 of 1935). 

Bingo halls, other than outdoor bingo at which persons 
attending do so in motor vehicles and remain in the vehicles 
without exiting the motor vehicles for the duration of such 
attendance. 

Private Members’ Clubs (howsoever described) where gaming 
(within the meaning of the Gaming and Lotteries Act 1956 (No. 
2 of 1956)) is carried on exclusively amongst members of the 
Private Members’ Club and is the primary purpose of such 
Private Members’ Club. 

Ice skating rinks other than insofar as such rinks operate 
outdoors on or after the 7th day of June 2021. 

Roller skating rinks other than insofar as such rinks operate 
outdoors on or after the 7th day of June 2021. 

Indoor leisure facilities, including dance studios and gyms, other 
than insofar as they provide facilities for use by persons taking 
exercise on an individual basis on or after the 7th day of June

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021) to 
provide for the easing of restrictions on events and the operation of businesses 
and services. The regulations provide for a list of permitted Scheduled 
Events. The Regulations shall remain in operation until 05 July 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 19
